MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Azure.Response Acquire (TimeSpan duration, Azure.RequestConditions conditions, Azure.RequestContext context);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Azure.Response Acquire(valuetype System.TimeSpan duration, class Azure.RequestConditions conditions, class Azure.RequestContext context) cil managed
Public Overridable Function Acquire (duration As TimeSpan, conditions As RequestConditions, context As RequestContext) As Response

abstract member Acquire : TimeSpan * Azure.RequestConditions * Azure.RequestContext -> Azure.Response override this.Acquire : TimeSpan * Azure.RequestConditions * Azure.RequestContext -> Azure.Response

Docs.param: Specifies the duration of the lease, in seconds, or specify for a lease that never expires. A non-infinite lease can be between 15 and 60 seconds. A lease duration cannot be changed using or .
Optional to add conditions on acquiring a lease.
Optional for the operation.
Docs.summary:
The operation acquires a lease on the blob or container. The lease must be between 15 to 60 seconds, or infinite (-1).
If the container does not have an active lease, the Blob service creates a lease on the blob or container and returns it. If the container has an active lease, you can only request a new lease using the active lease ID as , but you can specify a new .
For more information, see Lease Container.
Docs.returns: A as returned by the Storage service.
Docs.remarks: A will be thrown if a failure occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Azure.Response<Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobLease> Break (TimeSpan? breakPeriod = default, Azure.RequestConditions conditions = default, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = default);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Azure.Response`1<class Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobLease> Break(valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.TimeSpan> breakPeriod, class Azure.RequestConditions conditions, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

Public Overridable Function Break (Optional breakPeriod As Nullable(Of TimeSpan) = Nothing, Optional conditions As RequestConditions = Nothing, Optional cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Response(Of BlobLease)

abstract member Break : Nullable<TimeSpan> * Azure.RequestConditions * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> Azure.Response<Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobLease> override this.Break : Nullable<TimeSpan> * Azure.RequestConditions * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> Azure.Response<Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobLease>

Docs.param: Specifies the proposed duration the lease should continue before it is broken, in seconds, between 0 and 60. This break period is only used if it is shorter than the time remaining on the lease. If longer, the time remaining on the lease is used. A new lease will not be available before the break period has expired, but the lease may be held for longer than the break period. If this value is not provided, a fixed-duration lease breaks after the remaining lease period elapses, and an infinite lease breaks immediately.
Optional to add conditions on breaking a lease.
Optional to propagate notifications that the operation should be cancelled.
Docs.summary:
The operation breaks the blob or container's previously-acquired lease (if it exists).
Once a lease is broken, it cannot be renewed. Any authorized request can break the lease; the request is not required to specify a matching lease ID. When a lease is broken, the lease break is allowed to elapse, during which time no lease operation except
and can be performed on the blob or container. When a lease is successfully broken, the response indicates the interval in seconds until a new lease can be acquired.
A lease that has been broken can also be released. A client can immediately acquire a blob or container lease that has been released.
For more information, see
Lease Container.
Docs.remarks: A will be thrown if a failure occurs.

Docs.param: Optional to add conditions on releasing a lease.
Optional to propagate notifications that the operation should be cancelled.
Docs.summary:
The operation releases the container or blob's previously-acquired lease.
The lease may be released if the matches that associated with the container or blob. Releasing the lease allows another client to immediately acquire the lease for the container or blob as soon as the release is complete.
For more information, see
Lease Container.
Docs.returns: A describing the updated blob or container.
Docs.remarks: A will be thrown if a failure occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Azure.Response<Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobLease> Renew (Azure.RequestConditions conditions = default, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = default);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Azure.Response`1<class Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobLease> Renew(class Azure.RequestConditions conditions, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed
Public Overridable Function Renew (Optional conditions As RequestConditions = Nothing, Optional cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Response(Of BlobLease)

abstract member Renew : Azure.RequestConditions * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> Azure.Response<Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobLease> override this.Renew : Azure.RequestConditions * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> Azure.Response<Azure.Storage.Blobs.Models.BlobLease>

Docs.param: Optional to add conditions on renewing a lease.
Optional to propagate notifications that the operation should be cancelled.
Docs.summary:
The operation renews the blob or container's previously-acquired lease.
The lease can be renewed if the leaseId matches that associated with the blob or container. Note that the lease may be renewed even if it has expired as long as the blob or container has not been leased again since the expiration of that lease. When you renew a lease, the lease duration clock resets.
For more information, see
Lease Container.
Docs.remarks: A will be thrown if a failure occurs.
